info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 19 at 4:52PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, Berkeley and Charleston. * WHEN...Until 530 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 449 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms with torrential rainfall near Buck Hall, Awendaw and Halfway Creek. As much as 1 to 4 inches of rain has fallen in this area this afternoon. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. Motorists traveling US-17 near Awendaw and Steed Creek Road between US-17 and Halfway Creek Road should be alert for significant ponding of water on the road. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Awendaw, Huger, Smith, Limerick, Charity, Richmond, Buck Hall, Woodland, Hagan, Woodland Landing and Comingtee.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
